workout_file.description: Threshold Development: This training is targeting the increase in lactate threshold (FTP) with relatively short intervals at intensity of Zone 4.
workout_file.name: Week 6.2 - Threshold Development

textevent.message: We have a solid workout in store for today with a great mixture of zone 3, and zone 4 work...
Better get a good warmup in! Let's get the legs turning over and start loosening up.
3mins into it here. Keep easing into the day today.
That's halfway through the warmup. Let's chat about what we have in store for today...
Today, we're going to do mixture of zone 3 and zone 4 intervals.
And more specifically, 5, 4min intervals at zone 3, and 5, 5min interval at zone 4.
This training is targeting the increase in lactate threshold (FTP).
With relatively short intervals at intensity of Zone 4.
We'll also have some fun with cadence work, position changes, etc. to break up the intervals.
And with the slightly longer zone 4 intervals today compared to last week, we'll achieve progressive overload.
For now though, let's keep warming up :-)
All right, 30sec to go then we're headed right into our first zone 3 interval, at 90-100 RPM.
Here we go! Bring the effort and cadence up a bit more and let's settle into this.
These intervals by themselves would be a piece of cake, but cumulatively they're going to be a challenge.
Especially once we get to the last couple of zone 4 intervals :-) You got it though!
That's halfway already! These are short intervals, so the time should pass by quickly.
Just 30sec to go, then we'll take a quick 2min break. Great work!
Solid effort there, my friend. Let's take 2mins nice and easy here.
Next up, we're going to ramp the effort up at 90 RPM, get ready!
All right, let's start off at 84% FTP here, and keep the cadence steady at 90 RPM.
Keep on steadily ramping the power up, and keep your cadence nice and steady.
Halfway through! Awesome work!
Homestretch for this interval! We're peaking at 92% FTP!
Nicely done! Let's take a couple of minutes nice and easy again here.
In 30sec, we're going to do some fast/faster cadence work, starting at 95 RPM, ready?
Bring the power up here, and let's settle down at 95 RPM.
Up next, we're going to bring the cadence up to 105+ RPM, get ready!
FAST FEET! GO GO!
Great work, bring it back down again to 95 RPM for another minute.
Back up again QUICK! GO GO!
Great work! Take a couple of minutes nice and easy again here.
Up next, we're going to keep the cadence nice and high at 100 RPM from start to finish, let's make it happen!
GO GO GO! Get those legs really spinning here!
Settle down here and make sure you're not bouncing or lurching in the saddle.
Halfway! Keep that leg speed high! Don't let it drop off now!
C'mon! Push it all the way to the arch!
Boo yah! We're getting there now...Just 1 more zone 3 interval to go.
Next up, we're going to do another ramp effort at 90 RPM, this is it for the zone 3 work!
All right, let's start off at 84% FTP here, and keep the cadence steady at 90 RPM.
Keep on steadily ramping the power up, and keep your cadence nice and steady.
Halfway through! Awesome work!
Homestretch for this interval! We're peaking at 92% FTP!
Awesome! Next, we'll push the intensity up a bit higher, and this time right to FTP.
In 30 sec, we'll do 5mins right at FTP, at 90-100 RPM...You got this!
Here we go! Bring the power up even higher now and keep your cadence nice and quick.
Settle down now. You should notice a slightly higher heart rate here compared to the zone 3 intervals.
This is due to the higher intensity of working right at FTP, good stuff!
Halfway through here! Keep digging and pushing yourself!
Final minute! See if you can lift your cadence even higher now, really push it to the arch!
Beauty! That's the first of 5 for those efforts. Let's take a quick rest again here.
Threshold interval #2 is just ahead. This time I want to progressively increase the cadence each minute, starting at 90 RPM.
Nice and easy cadence-wise to start off here. We'll raise the cadence by 5 RPM every minute.
In 10sec, bring the cadence up to 95 RPM.
Slightly faster cadence now, but same effort. Keep yourself steady in the saddle.
Get ready for 100 RPM next...
GO GO GO! No bouncing or lurching in the saddle here!
Cadence up to 105 RPM next!
FAST FEET!! Push it here!
C'mon! Just 1 minute to go at 110 RPM!
EVEN FASTER! GO GO GO!
Push all the way to the arch!
Woo! Nicely done. Let's slow the cadence way down and recover a bit here... 3 to go!
Up next, I want you to aim for 100 RPM from start to finish, get ready!
FAST FEET again, this time from start to finish!
Relax your shoulders, loosen the grip on your bars, keep as relaxed as you can here!
2mins to go. Don't let your cadence drop now!
Final minute! Almost home now, keep your cadence UP!
Just 2 more intervals to go! You're doing amazing work today :-)
In 30sec, we're going to aim to alternate 95 RPM and 105 RPM every minute and 15sec.
Bring the power up here, and let's settle down at 95 RPM.
Up next, we're going to bring the cadence up to 105+ RPM, get ready!
FAST FEET! GO GO!
Great work, bring it back down again to 95 RPM for another minute and 15sec.
Back up again QUICK! GO GO!
Just 1 interval to go then we wrap this workout up! Let's give it everything for this finale.
All right, back up to 100 RPM from start to finish for this last effort. Let's make it happen!
UP UP UP! Get those legs spinning up quick!
I know you're tired by now, but keep going! This is when the training really starts!
Halfway done! Just a little bit more to go and you're done!
PUSH PUSH PUSH! Just 30sec to go and we're done!
WOW! That was a really tough workout with 40mins total of zone 3 and 4, but you ROCKED IT!
We're going to spend a few minute cooling down now, then we have another one in the books.
Enjoy the last few minutes of the cool down, and we'll see you next time!
